alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Caroline; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Louisa, Chesterfield, Goochland, central Caroline, northwestern Henrico, Hanover, Amelia and Powhatan Counties and the City of Richmond through 315 PM EDT... At 228 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles west of Fredericksburg to Bumpass to near Chula. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bumpass around 235 PM EDT. Ladysmith around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chilesburg, Orchid, Ammon, Maidens, Gum Tree, Three Square, Pocahontas State Park, Skinquarter, Beach and Chamberlayne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and north central Virginia.
